title: Getting Started with Next.js
description: Next.js is a modern React framework for creating lighting-fast, static websites, but also comes with the added ability of SSR (server-side rendering). In this Next.js tutorial series we'll learn how to create a Next.js application from the ground up & see how to deploy it to the web using Vercel & GitHub.

title: Node.js Crash Course
description: Node.js is a JavaScript runtime that allows us to run JavaScript code outside the confines of a browser! That means you can power your website's back-end using JavaScript with the help of Node.js. It also means you can run JavaScript directly on your computer - which is awesome! In this course you'll learn how to install Node & how to use it on your own computer. I'll also show you how to power a website using Node.js & Express (a node web framework), from scratch.

title: Next.js & Contentful Tutorial
description: In this course you'll learn how to make a content-driven website using Next.js & Contentful (which is a headless CMS). A headless CMS is a place to store content (like page content, blog posts, images etc) but without the front-end that a typical CMS comes with. For that, you'll use Next.js & pull in content stored in Contentful.

title: Firebase Hosting Crash Course
description: Firebase is a back-end service provided by Google & offers a multitude of products we can use - a real-time database, cloud functions, image storage, authentication and... Hosting. In this Firebase Hosting crash course I'll show you how to deploy your websites to Firebase.

title: Learn Go (Golang)
description: Go is a general purpose programming language which can be used for many things-to create REST API's, cloud services & build web apps. It's fast, it's fun & it's relatvely easy to pick up and run with. In this Go tutorial you'll learn how to install Go & use all the basic features & types. You'll also use your new found skills to reate a small command line application to create and save cafe bills. Check out the trailer below for more details.

title: Bootstrap 5 Crash Course
description: Bootstrap 5 is the newest version of Bootstrap to be released. In this series you'll learn how to use the Bootstrap CSS framework to create responsive & interactive web pages, from scratch. You'll learn about grid layouts, modals, navbars, cards, tabs & much more - as well as the new features & components in Bootstrap 5. You'll also see how to customize Bootstrap 5 to make your sites look more unique. See the course preview video at the bottom of the page for more info!

title: Build Websites with Vue 3 & Firebase
description: Learn Vue.js 3 (the latest major version) and Firebase from the ground-up to create amazing, interactive, content-driven & dynamic websites. In this course you'll learn Vue.js from the very beginning & create multiple projects - a live chatroom, a project planner, a reaction timer and a social music playlist site. You'll also learn the latest Vue 3 features such as the Composition API.

title: Flutter Tutorial for Beginners
description: Flutter is a mobile UI framework developed by Google, used to make native mobile apps. To create Flutter apps we use a language called Dart, also developed by Google. In this Flutter course, you'll learn the basics of Dart, from the ground up, and develop a Flutter app from scratch. I'll also show you how to preview your apps on an android emulator.

title: TypeScript Tutorial
description: TypeScript is a programming language that builds on JavaScript by adding extra features & static type definitions. For this reason it's becoming more and more popular with developers as an alternative to JavaScript to create websites. In this TypeScript tutorial series you'll learn TypeScript from scratch and learn about the many benefits it has to offer. I do assume basic JavaScript knowledge.

title: HTML & CSS Crash Course
description: If you're brand new to web development and ant to get started building websites, then look no further than this introduction to HTML & CSS. HTML & CSS are the core building blocks of front-end web development and are used to structure website content and control the visual design of them too. By the end of this course you'll have a great foundation in front-end web development & will be able to make your own responsive websites from scratch.
